tool_description: Given a company's webpage, or linkedin company url this rest API returns 25+ fields about the company including Crunchbase funding info, three to four employee profiles from the company, and recent company LinkedIn posts. Postman documentation available here: https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/10812513/UVeGpQqo
name: Linkedin Company Data
title: Linkedin Company Data

api_list.name: Get LinkedIn Company Data
api_list.description: Get all available data from a list of LinkedIn company pages. This endpoint should scale as far as you need it to without a problem
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://linkedin-company-data.p.rapidapi.com/linkedInCompanyDataJson"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "linkedin-company-data.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://linkedin-company-data.p.rapidapi.com/linkedInCompanyDataJson"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get List of Company Employees (alpha)
api_list.description: Returns a list of company employees given a company url provided. This endpoint was updated 6.14.2023 and will likely be updated again very shortly, still working out how to scale a new method.

required_parameters.name: page
required_parameters.description: A zero based index of the page being requested. Each page contains 100 unique results.

required_parameters.name: companyId
required_parameters.description: The numeric, unique id LinkedIn uses to identify the company you are requesting an employee list for. This can be obtained from /linkedInCompanyDataJsonV3Beta or the /linkedInCompanyDataJson endpoint.

api_list.name: Get Company Updates (beta)
api_list.description: Returns up to 100 recent company updates from LinkedIn company posts

optional_parameters.name: acceptLanguage
optional_parameters.description: Optional parameter that defaults to en-US if not provided. Will attempt to fetch the updates in a different language. For now, it only seems to affect the timeDescription value in the response at the moment.

api_list.name: Server Status
api_list.description: Checks that the server is alive and working

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "linkedin-company-data.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Company Data by Web Domain
api_list.description: Takes in a company domain (google.com for example) as input, and returns LinkedIn company data in a json format.

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Comments on Company Update Posts (beta)
api_list.description: Given the urn id returned from the company updates endpoint in updated in version 3.2 of the api, this endpoint returns data on comments from the requested post

api_list.name: Get LinkedIn Company Data (beta)
api_list.description: Returns company data for one company per request (for now). Created to provide clarity in scenarios where LinkedIn displays different industry categories for the same company (they are slowing moving to a new industry taxonomy) - this endpoint pulls both industry categorizations.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://linkedin-company-data.p.rapidapi.com/linkedInCompanyDataJsonV3Beta"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "linkedin-company-data.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Company Data by Keyword (100 Results)
api_list.description: Given a search keyword phrase, this endpoint returns 100 LinkedIn company data urls that can then be used to pull data about those companies.
